document.title: Class View and Object Browser Classes

paragraph.paragraph: Classes are the equivalent of NET types. The classes shown come in two varieties; Compiled and not compiled. Compiled classes are indicated by a blue icon ../images/class/class.png and uncompiled classes, which are those that have not been compiled into a project because they are not reachable from the url*root class, are shown as a gray icon ../images/class/class_not_in_system.png .
Class nodes will be located directly under clusters.xmlCluster Nodes and other class statuary browsing features, as contained in this document.
Expanding compiled class nodes displays much more information regarding the class, its url*features, url*ancestors and url*decendents.

Ancestors ../images/class/hier_class_ancestors.png
A tree of ancestor classes inherited by the expanded class.

Decendents ../images/class/hier_class_descendents.png
A tree of known decending classes, inheriting the expanded class.

Clients ../images/class/hier_class_clients.png
A tree of classes that refer to the expanded class using a url*client relationship.

Suppliers ../images/class/hier_class_suppliers.png
A tree of classes the expanded class is a url*client of using a url*supplier relationship.

Creation Routines ../images/class/hier_feature_creators.png
A tree of declared url*creation routines of the expanded class.

Inherited Features ../images/class/hier_feature_inherited.png
A flattened view of all of the expanded class' inherited url*features, inherited from url*ancestor classes.

All Features ../images/class/hier_feature_all.png
A flattened view of all of the expanded class's url*features merged with the features of any url*ancestor classes.
All of the node suceeding All Features are the url*features of the expanded class. Their icons and meanings are explained in the eiffel_icons.xmlEiffel Icons section of this documentation.

If you need to direct the ../../eiffel_editor/index.xmlEiffel Editor to any class found in the index.xmlClass View, a double-left mouse click on a corresponding class node will open the url*Eiffel class in the editor of the relevant class source in view.
Note: The index.xmlClass View will show .NET types when using the facilities to browse classes.xmlclass and feature url*ancestors, url*decendents, etc. Attempts to locate the related source will instead open the ../object_browser/index.xmlObject Browser and locate the appropriate node given the assembly, type and feature.
